lead_paragraph: In a little less than two years small savers in Great Britain have lent the Government $4,000,000,000 to help finance the war. This is roughly equal to $80 for every man, woman and child in the kingdom. An equivalent effort in this country would mean subscriptions of $10,400,000,000 to Defense Savings Bonds and Stamps in a like period.
